thread.title: 4,000 pounds of marijuana disguised as key limes seized at Texas border
thread.title_full: 4,000 pounds of marijuana disguised as key limes seized at Texas border

author: Eline de Bruijn
title: 4,000 pounds of marijuana disguised as key limes seized at Texas border
text:
4,000 pounds of marijuana disguised as key limes seized at Texas border Filed under Crime at Get Daily Dallas News Headlines Sign Up   
Officials at the Texas-Mexico border seized about 4,000 pounds of marijuana hidden in a shipment of key limes. 
U.S. Customs and Border Protection agents found the lime-shaped bundles of drugs in a commercial shipment Jan. 30 at the Pharr International Bridge, near Brownsville. 
Officers using a team of drug-sniffing dogs and nonintrusive imaging scanners to find the drugs after the tractor-trailer was referred for a secondary inspection, according to a statement from the agency. 
There were 34,764 packages containing 3,947.37 pounds of marijuana, according to the statement. Juiced: #CBP officers at Pharr Bridge seize 3,947 pounds of marijuana in lime-shaped bundles. Read more here: https://t.co/PRtqiWUKca pic.twitter.com/t2pG5BT47I — CBP South Texas (@CBPSouthTexas) February 7, 2017 
The drugs have a street value of nearly $800,000, and the case is being investigated by Homeland Security Investigations special agents. 
âThis is an outstanding interception of narcotics. Our CBP officers continue to excel in their knowledge of smuggling techniques, which allows them to intercept these kinds of attempts to introduce narcotics into our country,â said Efrain Solis Jr., director of the Hidalgo/Pharr/Anzalduas port of entry.
